params.newIssuerRegistry: The address of the new IssuerRegistry.
params.oldIssuerRegistry: The address of the old IssuerRegistry.

params.newTypeRegistry: The address of the new TypeRegistry.
params.oldTypeRegistry: The address of the old TypeRegistry.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

verifyProofFull(uint160,uint160,uint256,.details: Stateful verification of zero-knowledge proofs that checks      if the proof is valid and the issuer public key is active, and      for revocation checks if the the smt root matches.The trust relationship between the credential and issuer is binded by      the public key ID:      credential <--- signed by ---- publikc key <--- authroized by ---- issuer      As long as the issuer set the public key ID to be active, the credential is trusted by the issuer,      However, note that it does not mean that the credential is directly generated by the issuer.

verifyProofStatic(uint160,uint160,uint25.details: static verification of zero-knowledge proofs that only checks if the proof is valid.Code duplication is deliberate for clear separation of concerns.

IssuerRegistryUpdated(address,address).notice: Emitted when the IssuerRegistry is updated.

TypeRegistryUpdated(address,address).notice: Emitted when the TypeRegistry is updated.

userdoc.notice: @dev BabyzkVerifier is a contract that does on-chain stateful verification of zero-knowledge proofs.
